author: mr.mietrich
title: Advanced Cross-Translation Service
description: Most web-based translation services only perform well for a limited amount of language pairs. Many language pairs lack sensible translation.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal meets the challenge objectives well. It is very positive that the team involved here already has successful funding at f6, and the project is also in the area of ​​translation, which demonstrates that they already have experience and are competent to deal with this area. I also found it very good that this proposal intends to work with several languages, which are not so simple to translate, in a satisfactory way, using the automatic mechanisms that are already available today on the internet. I would have liked the authors to have explained the heart of the project in a more accessible way; I understood what they're going to do in general, but I was still a little confused in the details. The Dapp they intend to create (a parenthesis: this project also dialogues the challenge of Dapps, which is great as we could address two challenges in a single proposal) will work with "cross translation" from a "fixed set of lexemes" . I would like the authors to better conceptualize what exactly these concepts are, which are not so common and known, at least for those who do not work directly with translation. I also liked that they defined which languages ​​would be covered in the project, giving us a more solid sense of what is to come. In general, I believe the proposal will have a high impact, what I would ask is just to clarify some specific terms so that the general public can understand this idea more deeply.
f6_assessments.q1: I believe that the credibility of this team is very high, due to the following facts. First, that they already have a funded project in the area of ​​translation (it would be very interesting if they had made the final product available here, so that we could get to know it more closely and understand the characteristics of their work). Second, because they have attached a website where there is a space dedicated to the presentation of the team, containing a short description of each, as well as links that direct us to their individual pages, where we can get to know them better. And finally, due to the technical content of this proposal, so technical that I confess that I didn't understand 100% of the creations that would be made here, which demonstrates a lot of mastery over what is being worked on. Regarding the roadmap, we have here a breakdown of actions guided by the passage of time in quarters. It's a good summary of what will be done, however, I think we could have more details about each part. For example, in the third quarter of 2022, they plan to expand the database... But how will this be done, at what scale? We don't know exactly which languages ​​will be explored first and which ones would be part of the expansion, for example. I would also like to know more about the visual identity of the project (we have designers on the team, it would be important to understand how the interface is being designed, ie, how the end user would interact with Dapp), as I think it would be important to know more about the marketing of this project. The authors do not explain how they would spread the idea, make it reach the target audience, which is always important regardless of the proposal. Regarding the financial division, I believe that the details provided are satisfactory, the requested amount is well in line with the project, that is, it is not exaggerated and covers the costs of what will be worked well. So I think the only part I would like to know more about is the project progress, the steps, and details that don't exactly relate to the translation, like the construction of the UI/UX design and also the marketing plan.
f6_assessments.q2: Unfortunately, this was the part of the proposal that left the most to be desired; we have some KPIs that aren't quite detailed. I wish the authors had been more concerned with outlining ways in which the community could follow the progress of things, exercise auditability. The first 2 KPIs (number of lexemes supported / number of sentences) could have been explained further, what would be lexemes? (again), what would these sentences look like? Only the third KPI is more accessible, fully understandable for everyone, which is the number of platform users. I think for this project it would be necessary for the team to join the rest of the community to think of different ways to monitor the progress of the project. I suggest that they prepare reports periodically and present them to the rest of the community through some communication channel, some Discord server or even participation in a Town Hall. It would also be interesting if a speaker of each language that will be explored here could test Dapp and give feedback to the rest of the community, for example. In general, I believe that the auditability of this project needs to be revised to achieve more positive results.

f6_assessments.q0:
The concept has a lot of potential and can drive the project in the right direction.

Based on the information provided it seems that the proposal fits well in the challenge objectives. What is a bit unclear for an outsider is the way the website will get its content - as an output of this team efforts (as declared in the proposal) or as a contribution from the community members (there is a form on the website which seems to be dedicated to those onboarding for contribution) or a mix of both actions.
f6_assessments.q1:
The budget is outlined and broken down into identifiable items which are described well and it seems reasonable to achieve the set goals.

The proposal provides a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how. It is a somehow unclear what is the purpose of "Connect with existing translation and linguistic groups in the Cardano ecosystem" action. (is this for involving these people in this project and why they would do this? or it is to make use of their created content on the platform you want to build?)

The core team is presented on the platform and based of the references provided it seems that they posses the necessary skills and experience necessary for the implementation of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
There are also several metrics that measure the success of this project. I recommend adding further metrics about "the user satisfaction and the requested/necessary topics about Cardano to be translated" so that more areas of this project are auditable. If the proposed solution is successfully
implemented it provides a useful solution to the targeted problem.

The only thing I miss in this area is that the proposer has not mentioned possible difficulties and how to deal with them. (what if the project don't attract people as is expected?)

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer identifies the problem of limited translation services for some languages. It offers as a solution the building of a database community for cross translation of 14 languages. This proposal is in line with the challenge of motivating non-English speakers to learn about Cardano ecosystem
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer does not identify the team members or present evidence of their relevant experiences and skills for implementing the proposal. The budget is detailed and appears to be reasonable given the work to be done. The proposal presents a conductible plan that shows what will be done on the job. The proposal does not pose greater risks for its implementation. A reasonable deadline for completion of the work is established
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal presents a clear explanation of the target problem and the solution presented. The proposal presents a roadmap and KPIs that allow monitoring and evaluation of the proposal's progress and success

f6_assessments.q0: I agree on the need to have an Advanced Cross-Translation tool for Cardano ecosystem. So far I think this is the most relevant tool for this challenge even when it's the basic, not something new or creative. The application of this tool will be broad. However, I think the idea of how they can do the translation more sensible is not enough (They leverage the knowledge of the community to intuitively correct translations/choose the most appropriate translation out of different options. This can be a trap since we can not guarantee the commitment and quality of community support).
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal presented well how they will do it: with detail plan and the road map. The founder is experienced with successfully build the The Sandbox-MMO for language learning and assist community efforts to connect and form digital hubs in different languages. However I'm not sure about the community part. The database have to be really big to ensure the sensible of translation. (For example Google translate have big database but they the tool is still not sensible enough).
f6_assessments.q2: The road map is clear but the KPI does not include the quantities, which is a primary part of KPI. We need to measure the success of your project through community engagement, completion of the app etc

f6_assessments.q0: I strongly agree that this proposal addresses the challenge because it wants to build a Dapp for translating Cardano into 14 languages. We know there are many ideas about breaking language barrier in Cardano but there are not many proposers could provide the high-quality and sustainable solution for the community. Using FOSS-approachs and training of neural networks for machine translation, leveraging API of DeepL.com - are innovative ideas.
f6_assessments.q1:
The Educhainment is a six-member powerful team since I checked their website to learn, however there are only 3 of them will in-charge this proposal. I suggest the proposers to list down these people and their reference for the clarity of human resources. 
Development planning is written thoroughly, budget is broken down reasonably. I think this proposal will be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
Roadmap is clear with specific milestones.
KPIs haven't been discussed in the proposal, I advice team to estimate key metrics to success to figures so that the proposal becomes more completed.

solution: Community-built extendable database for cross-translation of fourteen+ languages, which are especially important for the Cardano ecosystem.
experience: Full-Stack Dev, UX/UI Design, Intercultural Translation, Language Teacher, Cultural Scientist, Fund 6 winner
